DataElement.preferredName: Abnormal Electrocardiography Adverse Event Present Ind-3
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no/unknown indicator for the presence of not normal electrical current in the heart as the unfavorable symptom temporally associated with the use of a medical product or procedure.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to presence of not normal electrical current in the heart as the unfavorable symptom temporally associated with the use of a medical product or procedure.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Deviating from the norm.:No value exists.:Any unfavorable and unintended sign (including an abnormal laboratory finding), symptom, syndrome, or disease, temporally associated with the use of a medical product or procedure, regardless of whether or not it is considered related to the product or procedure (attribution of unrelated, unlikely, possible, probable, or definite). The concept refers to events that could be medical product related, dose related, route related, patient related, caused by an interaction with another therapy or procedure, or caused by opioid initiation or dose escalation. The term also is referred to as an adverse experience. The old term Side Effect is retired and should not be used.

Concepts.definition: Deviating in any way from the state, position, structure, condition, behavior, or rule which is considered a norm.
A procedure that displays the electrical activity of the heart.

Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).

Property.preferredDefinition: Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

Concepts.definition: Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition:
any unfavorable symptoms, signs, or disease temporally associated with the use of a medical
treatment or procedure that may or may not be considered related to the medical
treatment or procedure.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/unknown.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/unknown.

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or unknown.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.2.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Retired DBW 4-27-2016 per Tina Taylor approved by Dianne Reeves

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. 3/35/2016 jk removed "indeterminate" value that was added in error. 7/7/2021wz: added ALT VM name for HOPE-CARE project.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Are there any clinically significant abnormalities

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Were there any clinically significant abnormalities

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: If abnormal, was the ECG clinically significant

ReferenceDocuments.name: ABTC-1601
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a clinically-relevant ECG abnormality?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history or presence of an abnormal ECG that, in the investigator's opinion, is clinically meaningful?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have resting ECG with clinically significant abnormal findings?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text_1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history of or presence of an abnormal ECG that is clinically significant in the investigator's opinion (including complete left bundle branch block, second- or third-degree heart block, or evidence of prior myocardial infarction)?

DataElement.origin: ECOG CRF:Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group Case Report Form
DataElement.changeDescription: Replaced VD Adverse Event Ind-3 (2018376v1) with VD Yes No Unknown Indicator (3506034v1)
DataElement.administrativeNotes: 2022.11.15 AQT added for ticket request CADSR0001687. ak
